alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Dubois; Martin; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 12:04PM EST until February 24 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Driftwood River near Edinburgh. East Fork White River at Shoals. Tippecanoe River near Delphi. Wildcat Creek near Lafayette. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Petersburg. .Rainfall last night and this morning of around an inch to an inch and a half along with a mixed precipitation system coming Wednesday night through Thursday night will create additional flooding on area rivers. Minor flooding is expected for most locations, but moderate flooding is possible on lower parts of the White and Wabash. Flooding along the main stem rivers is expected to continue into at least the first week of March. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River at Shoals. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Significant flooding of agricultural lands begins. Livestock in low bottoms must be moved to higher ground. Cemetery Road, East River Road, and SR 550 near Hindostan Church, and SR 257 south of Washington begins to flood. Water on Dubois CR 725 North in March 2011. Water receded from SR 550 during March 2011 on the south side of the river in the Loogootee area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to 20.1 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday morning and continue to fall slowly for several days. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued by late this evening.
